title:
php://memory and php://temp are read-write streams that allow temporary data to be stored in a file-like wrapper
Which statement is true about them?

choices.a: there is no diference between them; php://temp is alias to php://memory
choices.b: php://memory stored data is saved when stream is closed.
choices.c: php://memory will always store its data in memory, whereas php://temp will use a temporary file once the amount of data stored hits a predefined limit
choices.d: php://memory writes data to memory and php://temp writes data to temporary file
